Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MTCJ
Reviews.Content: This is a fine budget hotel with clean, comfortable rooms and friendly service. Nice rooftop terrace for breakfast and lounging, with outstanding views. Helpful staff. Surprisingly quiet location for something as central as this. We would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem hotel”
Reviews.Author: raniz
Reviews.Content: The best location between Blue Mosque and St. Sophia. Resonable room rate. Friendly staff and atmosphere. I would certainly stay in this hotel for my next visit to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Park my best”
Reviews.Author: dineshchennai
Reviews.Content: Hello friends, I am now here to say you all about Hotel Park. I think many of you are well aware of this but it was my first time I went there with my partner. I just enjoyed a lot with her over there. It was really the best I have ever visited and stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here. I Repeat, Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: JackChase
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the clean and quiet rooms, comfortable beds, friendly service, fine breakfast, and SPECTACULAR views, and of course the incredibly convenient location. I was deterred from booking this hotel online based on a couple of histrionic negative reviews on this page. I checked it out in person once I got to Istanbul and immediately checked out of my brand new hotel where I was paying twice as much for the same amount of space (and the privilege of trying to sleep next to an active railroad track) and grabbed a suite on the third floor of the charming Hotel Park and loved my stay. The negative reviewers here I suspect will find lots to complain about even if they were staying across the street at the Four Seasons (and paying $500/night). No, Hotel Park is not the 5 star Four Seasons, and when you're paying only one fifth the price of the Four Seasons, you will be happy with the solid 3 stars conditions of Hotel Park. The proprietor, Reza, was very friendly, accommodating, and helpful with whatever we needed. He ran out and got my wife some medicine when she was not feeling well, came through with very good suggestions for restaurants, laundry, and whatever we needed. He made quick arrangements and got me a taxi at discount rates to take me to the airport and back when I was in a rush and could not find a taxi without getting ripped off. Access to all the major tourist attractions, good places to eat, and shopping could not be easier. One look at the street map of Sultanahmet neighborhood will tell you how confusing the street layouts are, and it's easy to get lost. But, because of Hotel Park's proximity to the sights and central location, we never got lost walking around. But the hotel's biggest asset, better than 5 stars, is its two level roof deck with breathtaking wrap-around views of Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosque, and the Marmara Sea where it meets the Bosphorus. The view is spectacular enough by day--for breakfast. But even more so by night, when the city, and the very nearby historical buildings are lit up, while you relax with a drink in your hand after a day of sightseeing. I suspect I'll return in a couple of years and find Hotel Park has been bought out by a big company charging three times today's rate and replacing the friendly staff with the military efficiency and perfection the negative reviewers seek. Until then it remains an incredible value. So, by all means: Stay here. i repeat. Stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: freespirit82
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel can't be beaten. It is just a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia and is close to restaurants, shops and ATMs. The room was great - it had recently been renovated, and so the bathroom was very modern. The hotel has a lovely, homey feel with lots of Turkish rugs all over the place in the reception area and also in the room - it gave it a really different feel to some of the other places I stayed in Turkey. My only issue was that while the bathroom and the room were generally clean, there were a few little bits that had been missed - e.g. something in the bin. It didn't really bother me - I was just a bit surprised. The staff were really helpful, especially Sahin, the guy who works on reception of an evening - he made me a cup of tea when I came in from an evening out, and generally did everything he could to make me feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!! Repeat! Do not stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cicamica
Reviews.Content: Initially we were suppose to stay at Terrace Guest House(owner Dogan) but problems with the bathroom made us to change. As i mentioned on the Terrace Guest House review Hotel Park belongs to Dogan's father. Shall we say we jumped out of the frying pan into the fire!!! This place is the shabbiest accomodation we have ever stayed at... We were first put in room no3 which is a poxy double room that reeked of cigarette smoke and the window wouldn't close...so we complained!!!were shown room no4, a triple room with the most disgusting bathroom...several tiles missing, shower was really manky and rusty! Finally we were taken all the way to the top floor and shown a smallish double room(no22) with a decent, newish looking shower room. But the only view from the window was the fire staircase. Also the main ventilation system outlet was right on top of the roof just above our room rattling away constantly! On several occassions we had to call reception because there was no water coming from either the basin tap nor the shower itself. Radiator wasn't fully working, when complained to receptionist he told us that the room was warm enough for him!!! what a joke! Breakfast area is in the basement,kitted out with plastic garden furniture(originally white now grey with dirt!!!) which they use in the summer on the roof terrace. Very tacky!!! Breakfast itself is very basic, white bread, jam, hard boiled eggs, tomatoes, cucumber, olives. No juice and no fresh fruit on offer! If we would have had more time we wouldn't have stayed at this hotel but would have gone to find somewhere else.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Park
HotelInfo.Address: Utangac Sok. No:26 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
